member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.Query.ExtensionMethods.Extent``1(Telerik.OpenAccess.IObjectScope)
member.summary: Returns an IQueryable instance usable for Linq queries.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.Query.ExtensionMethods.Matches(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns true when the string matches a certain regular expression using * and ? wildcards.

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.Query.IObjectScopeQuery`1
member.summary: Tagging interface so that the compiler can keep better track of whom to call in presence of all the Queryable extension methods. This allows Telerik.OpenAccess Linq queries to be compile-time checked and allows to produce warning messages for inefficient expressions.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.Query.IObjectScopeQuery`1.ToList
member.summary: Executes the query and returns a typed result list.
member.remarks: This method is mostly useful for use with anonymous types.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.Query.IObjectScopeQuery`1.BackendQuery
member.summary: Returns the query for as generated for the given backend (SQL).
member.remarks: The query needs to be performed before this property contains a meaningful value.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.Query.IObjectScopeQuery`1.ParallelFetch
member.summary: Controls whether parallel fetches are permitted or not.
member.remarks: Default value is False and parallel fetches must explicitly turned on.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.Query.IObjectScopeQuery`1.IgnoreUncommitted
member.summary: Controls whether uncommitted data is ignored by the query.
member.remarks:
Default value is True : all uncommitted data is ignored.
Persistence by reachability is maintained for the time of Flush(), but not for the time of Commit().
member.value: True when the all changed data is flushed to the backend server prior to execution of this query.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.Query.IObjectScopeQuery`1.ForwardsOnly
member.summary: Controls whether the returned result is only forward iterable or allows random access.
member.remarks:
Using ForwardsOnly=True can be more performant in certain situations where large result sets must be returned.
Default is False; random access is allowed.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.Query.IObjectScopeQuery`1.Debug
member.summary: Controls whether the debug information is given.
member.remarks: When set to True, the Linq Expression tree is presented in graphical form.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.Query.FormTreeDisplay.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.
member.param: true if managed resources should be disposed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.Query.FormTreeDisplay.InitializeComponent
member.summary: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.Query.ParamPos
member.summary: Names or references a parameter expression.

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.Query.LinqParameter2QueryParameter
member.summary: Walks the Linq expression tree and finds all parameters.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.Query.QueryContext.ResolveGroup``2(``1)
member.summary: Resolves the IGroupable produced by this query for the given key.
member.typeparam: Grouping type (the key of the group)

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.Query.ScopingNames
member.summary: Implements a scoped name resolution for nested lambda expressions and parameters.
